XS7rSWjDbG2Gn-zXBxP0Ew.text: This is my wife's all time favorite chicken rice place and it became mine as well! We ordered both roasted and steamed chicken. They were both very tender and soft. The rice tasted great and was cooked with their stock. Their chicken rice is 5-stars. The side barbecue pork was a little hard and dry. The ambience is casual. This place is great for quick meals. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Big Bird - Singapore, Singapore

MHgjcA4CeHEwoaCPi5NVJA.text: My first time here. Charge for 1 person chicken rice cost $6.80....not worth the price, cos I can get exactly the same potion and taste from most of the chicken rice stall in Singapore at a cheaper price.The chili here is very spicy, too spicy to kill the taste of the chicken rice.Don't think I'll be back here, unless nearby and craving for chicken rice.Oh yes, the chicken rice I ordered does not comes with soup.....you have buy!!!This place air conditioning need to change, I was perspiring when I was eating inside....no tissue here too

photos.caption: Photo of The Big Bird - Singapore, Singapore. $6.80!!!!

Y1UU_sBgB_2O2b29UxSUAQ.text: Had takeaway lunch here and ordered a chicken drum stick rice, a small portion of xiao bai cai (vege), and a barley water (home made). Total damage = $14.90, which I think is overpriced for... Chicken rice. $7.50 for the chicken drumstick rice and $5.50 for the vege. They are good, but maybe my taste sense lacks the sophistication to differentiate between good chicken rice and very good chicken rice.. They all taste pretty similar to me and a $3-4 chicken rice is all I need. Watch out for the chili sauce - it's really spicy!

2wOJBTWoJNr2M6F1L9EgLw.text: Not sure what the rave is about but the chili is too hot to taste anything. Not salty, not fragrant..only spicy..Caught a staff cleaning the inside of the food display glass during dinner time. Not so sure about have newspapers wiping just above the food. Not too hygienic in my opinion.Overpriced for the quality that they serve..

pIu4psJCUTuZvI2ApJccNA.text: Love Big Bird. Chicken rice is so moist and fragrance. I am all for the smooth, juicy steam white chicken but roast chicken is just as good. Bonus Pte: derrick and Betsy does a mean Cze Cha dishes. Highly recommend: seafood omelet, mee sua, Poh piah, steam cold crab. Die die must try. Especially if you are chili lover

Q1ljh4rmS_Ui4gu4welm1A.text: Amazing chicken rice and kind staff. Food here is quite fresh and well cooked. However the price is like a Korean restaurant already. Expensive for local Singaporean food IN SINGAPORE. Wish the price could go down a bit. But the taste is confirm very shiok. Plus I love the spicy chilly sauce here. It is REAL! :)

zpcLFU7CFRvpqICFr559hw.text: Possibly the best chicken rice in SG.  Rice is fragrant and seasoned well. The chicken is served warm.. You just can't expect service in this place... The only bad thing is the price is higher than most. But seriously, very good chicken rice.

W2WTSjLVZiwPqzp-3dbcNA.text: This was probably a place that had its popularity boom in the 90s and in the early noughties but has since experienced a dip in business because it didn't manage to keep up with the times, decided to overcharge ($5 for a measly plate of chicken rice?!), struggling to survive (shrugs). Just happened to be around Balmoral Plaza with a friend and we had the chicken rice (we always went to Novena to do Wee Nam Kee but we'd been doing that for the past 4-5 chicken rice expeditions so we wanted a change, but lesson learned - ALWAYS stick to WNK), it was insufficient and we even 'upsized', but were still disappointed. Chicken was bony, chilli was pretty good, ginger was too watery, and drinks were bordering on $1.50 as well. I guess the ACS boys (and peeps from other international schools and the high-heeled people in this neighborhood) nearby can afford this and find it alright, but I will always agree with the fact that Chicken Rice should be capped at $3 (I'm frowning at you, Chatterbox), and if it should cost more than $3, I would expect it to be lip-smackingly delicious or be a gargantuan serving... otherwise...

t_iuouebNrm6fESuwjinVQ.text: Big bird chicken rice is so underrated! Maybe because it isn't an 'authentic' chicken rice restaurant in in Singapore. But I have to say, the chicken rice is so good, the soups are excellent, the seafood omelette is very good (not as good as malaysian hochien, but good enough). Officially our fave chic rice restaurant after 5 star.
